intro: Leucopsis, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, often white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. They are typically found in temperate regions and prefer well-drained soils. Leucopsis species are often used in gardens for their ornamental value. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem.
